abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth Economic
            Governance and Recovery Grant Project for Togo were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            one lesson is that ensuring progress in a stand-alone
            Development Policy Operation (DPO), in an environment with
            low capacity by the recipient, requires the ability to
            supervise closely. A second lesson is that, in the face of
            low recipient capacity, the Bank's team needs to remind
            the authorities about the importance of the results
            framework and the implications of not meeting indicators. A
            third lesson regards the care that needs to be extended at
            the definition of prior actions and results indicators. A
            final lesson is that meaningful reforms (such as in cotton)
            may take years to complete and are hard to support by annual
            stand-alone DPOs.
